str2: Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To look up, recover my sight. From ana and blepo; to look up; by implication, to recover sight.
Lame, deprived of a foot, limping. Apparently a primary word; 'halt', i.e. Limping.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
A leprous person, a leper. From the same as lepra; scaly, i.e. Leprous.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.
(lit: blunted) dumb, dull, deaf. From kopto; blunted, i.e. of hearing or speech.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble devout persons) or bad.
